channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Where the Gaza Cease-Fire Deal Goes Now Is Uncertain. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: As negotiators are holding discussions on multiple tracks, Palestinians and Israelis are in limbo.

item.title: Over a Dozen Conservative Party Donors Fund Nigel Farage’s Reform U.K.
item.description: A New York Times analysis of campaign finance data also revealed an influx of funding to Nigel Farage’s right-wing party from fossil fuel investors, c...

item.title: Brad Lander Would Declare Housing Emergency if Elected N.Y.C. Mayor
item.description: Mr. Lander wants 500,000 homes to be built in the city. Nearly every candidate has the crisis as a top issue.

item.title: Trump Issues ‘Last Warning’ to Hamas to Release Israeli Hostages
item.description: In a blistering social media post, the president told Hamas that if it continued to hold hostages, “you are DEAD!”

item.title: Alphabet CFO offers bullish view of Waymo as the future of transportation
item.description: Waymo develops self-driving technology and operates autonomous vehicles.

item.title: Three McKinsey chief diversity and inclusion officers argue that the biggest issue facing women at work is the ‘broken rung’
item.description: McKinsey’s Lareina Yee and two fellow senior partners are behind the new book The Broken Rung.

item.title: Who Paid for Trump’s Transition to Power? The Donors Are Still Unknown.
item.description: President Trump has not made good on a promise to disclose who contributed to his transition effort.

item.title: Europe Races to Craft a Trump-Era Plan for Ukraine and Defense
item.description: European leaders are gathering in Brussels to discuss how to support Ukraine and fend more for themselves on defense.

item.title: Over a Dozen Conservative Party Donors Fund Nigel Farage’s Reform U.K.
item.description: A New York Times analysis of campaign finance data also revealed an influx of funding to Nigel Farage’s right-wing party from fossil fuel investors, c...

item.title: Juan Hamilton, Georgia O’Keeffe’s Companion and Contested Heir, Dies at 79
item.description: As a young potter, he turned up on the doorstep of an octogenarian master of modern painting. They grew so close it became a scandal.

item.title: Some Schools Rethink “College For All”
item.description: The idea that every student should aim for a four-year college motivated a bipartisan movement for decades. Now even enthusiastic promoters of the ide...

item.title: FIFA to Consider Expanding World Cup to 64 Teams
item.description: Soccer’s governing body will look into another expansion of its marquee event, the most lucrative in sports, after a request by one of its 2030 co-hos...

item.title: Trump’s tariff showdown is making workers nervous. Here’s how HR leaders should talk about it at the office
item.description: Workers across industries are concerned that Trump’s tariff policy could lead their company to lay off workers.

item.title: Who runs Tesla: The top power players at Elon Musk’s biggest company
item.description: All the top executives that Musk has installed at his EV pioneer.

item.title: Volkswagen’s ID EVs faltered in the U.S.—now it’s banking on a revived American brand
item.description: As EV sales cool, VW looks to a defunct brand Scout for U.S. growth.
